javadoc: SimpleSourceReferenceIterator is a unidirectional iterator over the CodeBlockReferences for a CodeBlock. It is not failfast, whenever hasNext() are called it will find if there is a next CodeBlockReference and acquire a handle if there is one. If new code units are added to the listing after the iterator is created it will find them as it scans ahead.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct an Iterator over Source blocks for a CodeBlock.

params.name: block
params.comment:
block to get destination blocks for.  This should be a
 block obtained from SimpleBlockModel.

params.name: followIndirectFlows
params.comment: indirect references will only be included if true

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getNumSources
methods.comment:
Get number of source references flowing from this subroutine (block).
 All Calls to this block, and all external FlowType block references
 to this block are counted.

params.name: block
params.comment: code block to get the number of source references to.

params.name: followIndirectFlows
params.comment: indirect references will only be included if true

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

name: SimpleSourceReferenceIterator
comment:
SimpleSourceReferenceIterator is a unidirectional iterator over the CodeBlockReferences
 for a CodeBlock.  It is not failfast, whenever hasNext()
 are called it will find if there is a next CodeBlockReference and acquire
 a handle if there is one. If new code units are added to the listing after
 the iterator is created it will find them as it scans ahead.
